posts.message: في شكاوي إن مواقع وخدمات مش شغالة كويس أو بتفصل فجأة أو مش راضية تحمل سواء ناس متصلة على 3G شركات موبيل أو ADSL في بيوت ومكاتب.. في تطبيق استخدامه سهل جدا تقدروا من خلاله اجراء فحص سريع على الشبكة عشان يكشف عن وجود مشاكل بتأثر على الخدمات أو وجود تقنيات مراقبة أو حجب ويعرفكم بيحصل ايه بشوية تفاصيل فنية. التطبيق متاح لهواتف أندرويد (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.openobservatory.ooniprobe) وأبل (https://itunes.apple.com/US/app/id1199566366). اللعبوا كده وتعالوا نشارك النتائج ونتناقش فيها ونفهم

Hello everyone
There is a problem in our business model and we are trying to solve it and i would appreciate opinions
 
For every user he is allowed to use under his account up to 4 devices ( we deliver premium content and we want to limit access ) , in the past we used to use device id (ios & Android ) and now to Access such information we need to explicitly ask for phone permission on Android 6.0+. And we want to use something else that is less scary and keeps the user privacy yet unique per device. 
I've thought of instance ID , GUID but I'm not sure if there is a better solution and which to choose
Another huge news: Native ECMAScript (ES6) modules are implemented in Firefox 54 (Nightly)
posts.caption: blog.hospodarets.com
posts.description: The first overview of the native ECMAScript modules, how to make them work, differences with the bundled modules, tips and tricks.

posts.message:
At the risk of sounding like a broken record, have we dropped all hope in enforcing the group rules? The group is full of posts that are either job ads or questions by people who are too lazy to type into Google. There are quality posts that get buried beneath all of that.

I'm not just venting or throwing rhetorical questions. Is it undoable, doable but needs more personnel, or deemed  as not important anymore?

posts.description: I recently made a post on Reddit showcasing my Grafana dashboard. I wasn’t expecting it to really get any clicks, but as a labor of love I thought I’d spark the interest of a few people. I got a significant amount of feedback requesting that I make a blog post to show how I setup the individual part...

posts.description: Enough is enough. We've gone from labor being an equitable contract to the beggar CEO asking for more and more labor for nothing. Time to stop it.
